name: Sathvik Redrouthu
short_description: Sathvik Redrouthu is associated with Etched and Y Combinator. He has published research on optoelectronic hardware accelerators and tensor algebra, focusing on optical MATMUL accelerators and photonic integrated circuits for matrix transformations.
long_description:
Sathvik Redrouthu is a technology professional currently affiliated with Etched and Y Combinator. His background includes significant research in advanced computing technologies, particularly in the field of optoelectronic hardware acceleration.

Sathvik has authored several publications focusing on innovative computing architectures. His work includes "Tachyon: A Programmable Optoelectronic Hardware Accelerator for Ultrafast Tensor Arithmetic" and "Tensor Algebra on an Optoelectronic Microchip," both published by Springer. These publications detail the design, implementation, and programming of optical MATMUL (matrix multiplication) accelerators, as well as tensor algebra compilers for these specialized systems.

Additionally, he contributed to research on "Using Interferometer-Based Photonic Integrated Circuits to Perform Rapid Unitary Transformations," which explores implementing unitary matrix transformations by routing light through Mach-Zehnder interferometers, with applications in optical matrix-vector multiplication.

His LinkedIn profile shows active engagement with content related to emerging technologies, particularly in quantum computing, semiconductor development, and advanced computing architectures. With 3K followers and 500+ connections, Sathvik appears to be well-connected in the tech community, particularly in cutting-edge computing technology circles.

Sathvik maintains a personal website at sathvikr.com, suggesting he has an established professional presence beyond his LinkedIn profile.
